Group trip
review_text:
Great cottage and pictures do not do it justice. Even nicer in person. Very clean cottage, comfortable, and quiet neighborhood. Kathryn was very responsive and helpful. :)
A couple of things that could be improved. The back slider lock didn't seem to work and there was a piece of wood in the jam to secure it. I assumed that is why the wood was in place. I let Kathryn know about the lock and she offered to take a look at it, but I didn't see her message until the night before we left. So a bit unsettling, but she was quick to respond. Also, no blinds or curtains on the back window or slider. I would absolutely recommend window covering for privacy. Especially since we showed up at night. Window covering are a must.

review_text:
Great cozy and clean spot in Medford! Check-in was seamless and house was well prepared and clean when we arrived.
Lots of fun quality of life touches which make the place more comfortable: nice toiletries, plenty of blankets and towels, nice kitchen implements, and a little basket of items for your dog!
Location is very pet friendly, was very convenient to have a little pet station set up, and a small fenced in yard to let our dog stretch out.
Kathryn was also very communicative in preparation for the stay, offering comprehensive info on the house, and was very clear on the check out process. Would definitely return if we're in the area again!

review_text: Our stay was very comfortable and pleasant. The house was immaculate when we arrived and had all the comforts of home. We stayed for three weeks and enjoyed walking to the nearby park and being within a 5-10 min drive of everything we needed. The neighborhood is very quiet and the few planes that flew over were more fun than annoying. We spent hours on the deck in the morning even during days that were in the high 90s. We floated the Rogue, spent several nights watching sunsets from county parks along the river, hiked the Pacific Crest Trail, visited Crater Lake Natl Park, and say a show at the Britt Festival in historic Jackonsville. Kathryn was extremely responsive and helpful.

review_text: I stayed with Lillian and Bill on my way from WA to CA. They very kindly offered to let me park in their garage since I was fully loaded with stuff. However, the neighborhood felt very safe so I just parked on the street and had no issues. This was my first time staying in a home with the host on site. It was a little awkward (wrong) feeling just letting myself into their home without knocking first However, Lillian (and Marley the dog who is sweet as can be) greeted me very shortly after I arrived, and was very warm and I felt instantly welcomed and right at home. So for anybody who is hesitant to stay on site with a host let me assure you this is a great place to start. You do feel like you have complete privacy with the bedroom and bathroom being separate from their area. I took an evening walk enjoying the beautiful homes and gardens in the neighborhood and read my book on the front porch until dusk. Very rejuvenating after a long drive. I would definitely stay here again.

review_text: Excellent stay! Very nice neighborhood. The marked spot to park was helpful. Far enough from the freeway to feel like a neighborhood, but close enough to the freeway for convenience. Really liked the healthy breakfast in the morning -- made it fast for me to get on my way ready for the day. Also loved having a robe, was like a hotel and made it easy to unwind after a long day of driving. Quiet and easy to get to sleep. Well situated in the house for privacy. Note that the mattress is a pillow-top, it is a bit soft for those of us who prefer a firm mattress. Still got a great sleep and a 5-star stay. Chatted with Lillian in the morning -- friendly and felt very comfortable. Would stay again if going thru Medford.

Lillian and a bill are very friendly and interested in their quests and making them comfortable. Their pup, Marley is shy but adorable. Communication was great. Instructions were clear and they also accommodated my late arrival. Great coffee n home grown figs and homemade banana bread.
Thank you !!

name: Ailise
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Lillian and Bill are fabulous hosts and their home is incredibly warm and welcoming. It is cozy, comfortable, and decorated with a great assortment of art from their travels. The bed was delightfully comfortable, the room nice and bright with a good writing desk and a really comfortable arm chair for reading. I really liked that the bedroom and bathroom are at the other end of the house from their rooms and the kitchen/dining area. It was wonderfully private, but just off the front room, so didn't feel too set apart. Everything was very much like visiting family or friends, which is what appeals to me the most about Airbnb. Lillian and Bill are both so personable and interesting: you'd do yourself a disservice if you stayed with them and didn't get to chatting! I felt comfortable from the moment I walked in. They have a great front patio area, which has lovely shade and plants and cushioned chairs, very nice for enjoying their quiet, residential neighborhood. There are some delicious restaurants and coffeehouses within a quick, 15-minute walk, if that: less than a mile away. You could easily walk into downtown Medford in 20 minutes or so of happy ambling through one of my favorite neighborhoods in town: older, tree-lined streets, beautiful Craftsman and turn-of-the-century homes, little bungalos, even a few cobbled streets. It's a great walk into, say, Ruby's on Genessee. Lillian and Bill have clearly curated their home to be a home away from home. There is nothing at all that feels anonymous or "hotel-like" about their place. Marley the dog makes a great greeter, as well.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
This is probably my fourth time staying here. It’s comfortable, welcoming, and cozy. Beds are VERY comfortable. Previously one was quite squeaky, but it’s either been replaced or repaired, because that was no longer an issue!
Very welcoming of pets. They provided pet food dishes, an extra leash and waste bags, and many pet beds strewn throughout the house. The backyard is well-fenced with no holes or gaps that even our tiny (11-ish pounds) dog could wriggle through.
Kitchen has all the basics, as well as a good selection of herbal teas.
Wren is lightning-fast to reply to any requests or messages, and was able to accommodate our early check-in request.
Will definitely stay here again!

The cottage at Maryl’s place was very clean and well located. And, we found Maryl to be happy, kind and helpful.
The cottage is quite small if traveling with a lot of stuff. We were on a 2 week roadtrip so had luggage, cooler, pet supplies etc., so it felt quite small for the two of us and our pup. Maybe most people wouldn’t travel with this much stuff, so the size would be fine. We were surprised by the shared courtyard. I believe it must have been listed, but I somehow overlooked it. Just wanted to mention this in case others might miss this too. We had a couple of challenges while there, so left a day early. Renters from this date on can look forward to a new air-conditioning unit that Maryl is having installed. We would recommend Maryl’s cottage to others. She is a kind and gracious host.

This was our second stay at this lovely cottage in Jacksonville. Obviously, we loved it enough the first time to come back for a second stay.
This place is so cute and quaint, and perfectly situated far enough away from town that you don’t hear the hustle and bustle, but close enough to where you can walk to the local pubs and restaurants.
Inside, we found blankets for our furry friend, and snacks for ourselves and plenty of cold water in the fridge. Also, the bed in this place could not be more comfortable.
We will be back for another stay next time we are in Jacksonville.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We recently moved to Salem, but I had to come back for a medical procedure. Maryl's place just as she described it would be! When we entered the little courtyard to the cottage we were delighted. Green plants everywhere, a fountain, a little table and chairs with an umbrella. As we entered the Airbnb, we were greeted by the smell of fresh baked cookies. After we unpacked, we each ate a cookie and at the same time we said, "Man! These cookies are amazing!" Then we ate the rest of those delicious cookies! We only wished that there had been about a dozen more!! The cottage was very clean and tidy throughout. I went out into the courtyard at night, it was BEAUTIFUL with all of the lights! The host left notes inside to tell you how to work this and that was helpful. The bed was also VERY comfortable! We both got a great night's sleep. As we were leaving in the morning, we met our delightful host. Maryl is a wonderful lady! We will be definitely staying here again!

review_text: We drove from over 800 miles in one day from San Diego, Ca. and arrived in the early evening. We were both tired from the long drive up and were relieved to know that the check in was flexible and we had to do was to walk right in since the door was left unlocked for us. When we arrived we found a very cozy cottage that was tucked away in a peaceful area of the neighborhood. The entrance was through a very lovely patio surrounded by ivy and with a small working fountain. We had all the amenities included in the cottage that we would need during our stay there. The cottage was so arranged that the moment you entered it you felt like you were at home. Maryl was an excellent hostess and had prepared for our stay. I didn't get a chance to meet and talk with her until we were just getting ready to leave on our last morning. She was very gracious and given us a very nice stay there in her cottage. Will be looking forward to staying there again in the future when we come back again.

review_text: I made a blunder and went to the main house. Disrupted Maryl and her pups along with our travel weary doxie. Nonetheless Maryl was very congenial about it. Prior to our arrival she contacted us with a kind and personal greeting. We use Airbnb a lot and very few hosts make personal contact. Maryl is refreshing. We stayed overnight because of a drs appointment. The cottage was perfect for us all. A soft lovely doggie blanket for Auggie who loves fluffy things to sleep on. And wonderful chocolate chip homemade cookies just the way I like them, chewy, chocolatey and nutty. It was cold but the cottage was warm toasty and cozy. Trails near by. We’ll be back. Thank you Maryl.

review_text: My wife and I enjoyed our short stay in Maryl's cottage. Everything just fits with the small, tasteful Jacksonville feel - easy swinging gate into a front sitting courtyard, decor and night lights spread throughout, low traffic hiking trail within a quarter mile, homemade cookies waiting for us inside - we loved it! It was a bit of a walk to downtown Jacksonville, taking about 20-25 minutes at a comfortable walking pace. Thank you, Maryl!

name: Karen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Cozy Jacksonville Cottage is just perfect! Suites one or two adults with or without behaved pet. The cottage is basically two rooms, plus shower. Kitchenette is simple with a small fridge (think dorm size), a hot plate and microwave. The sitting area is also in that room. The Cottage is very comfortable. The cost, very affordable. Importantly, as a single, I felt very safe!
Parking is close, on the same level, so no lugging heavy luggage far at all! Maryl, the friendly and nice hostess, makes check in and check out simple (one less thing to worry about). You'll also find a homebaked surprise on the kitchenette counter when you arrive. A point to note, altho' the hostess lives adjacent to the cottage, no one is the least bit intrusive. Welcoming? Yes!
The cottage is in a great location, just one half mile from "town" an easy walking distance. I found three area's for a morning walk near by. One is just down the street from the Cottage; enjoy the deer! Then there is the Beekman Aboretum and the Britt Garden (woods). Each are a gentle walk from the Cottage.
The Cozy Cottage is aptly located for the Britt Fest events, too, just 0.6mi away.
Some favourite places I explored for food each have Gluten Free options (I know, I ate them!)
The Good Bean for coffee & a muffin, breakfast or lunch.
The Jacksonville Inn has three dining areas (and an oh-so fabulous beet salad).
UmI Sushi - hand made as you order. Yummm
Being in wine country is always fun and South Stage Cellars is on the corner. I'm so glad I stopped there! All of these eateries are just a half mile from the Cozy Jacksonville Cottage. FYI - Medford is a 20 min drive, Ashland is 30 minutes.
I'm looking forward to my next trip to discover more about Jacksonville and I hope to stay at the Cozy Cottage!

I only stayed at Kathryn’s place for a night! Driving from Seattle with dogs and needing a place to stay for the night, I was willing to stay just about anywhere. I’m glad it was Kathryn’s place!
Even at nearly 10pm at night, the place was easy to locate. The instructions with photos made finding it in the dark so much more easier - I can only imagine what it was like in the daylight! The yard was wonderful for my pups for stretch their legs.
When I entered the space felt very spacious for me and two medium / large dogs. Everything that was included was thoughtful, and the space was beautiful.
If I wasn’t so keen on getting back on the road I would’ve enjoyed my full stay, and stayed longer.
I did hear planes, but for me it wasn’t a problem! Reminded me of home.
Nevertheless, would stay here again! Thank you so much 🤍

review_text:
This stay was exactly as described and comfortable and easy. Such a generous interaction with Kathryn and accommodating of our check in and out needs. This reno of a garage was so well done with quality and attention to detail. The eco friendly products and bonus charcoal bamboo toothbrush and tablet toothpaste was generous and a good way to introduce folks to alternative options. Thank you!
The neighborhood was quiet and a huge open space and park for the pup was super close.
The only thing that might be a struggle for some folks that I was surprised wasn’t mentioned, is that it’s right near the airport (had no idea Medford had an airport) so the landing plans flew really low above the house every hour or so into the night. This was startling and a bit annoying for us at first and our pup didn’t love it. Manageable and not a complaint, a great overall stay, but just a heads up for more sensitive folk.
Thank you Kathryn.

review_text:
Very clean and accommodating. Had sort of last minute stay because our nearby home was having a floor repair. This was perfect, 2 twenty pound cats and a little 9 pound dog were easily accommodated with us for three days. Everyone was comfy.
Two suggestions are that you could -
1) oil or finish the cute kitchenette so it easier to keep clean without water spotting and remove the teflon frying pan since it's not compatible with the induction burner, and
2) let people know to approach the driveway at an angle so your vehicle doesn't scrape. Our Prius was so low it was difficult until we figured that out.
Very cute and tasteful decorating. Loved the shower soap. Thanks so much!
Margaret

review_text:
I knew this was going to be a good airbnb for us and our pups given the overwhelming number of positive reviews, but here are a few extra things that brightened our stay:
- There was a surprising amount of space inside. The photos don’t do it justice! It was just perfect for us and two large dogs.
- For being a converted garage, whoever did the remodel did an impressive job. Grout lines were clean, doors were flush, fixtures were nice, not cheap and flimsy.
- Lovely selection of herbal teas
- Offered to do our dishes for us if we left them behind
These, in addition to all that was stated in previous reviews, are some of the reasons we will definitely stay here again!

The bed is super soft and comfy and there is a place for two to dine and watch the smart TV.
There are extra blankets underneath the bed, I believe.
There’s a large bathroom with linens and a shower with good water pressure…
The house in front is also an Airbnb, though it feels private at the studio.
Kathryn responded quickly when asked any question and is really sweet.
We highly recommend Kathryn’s place for a nice, quiet stay.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a great place to stay in Medford. You can avoid the hotels and busy intersections and noisy truck traffic and enjoy a quiet neighborhood. It's just the right size for a couple, maybe someone with one child, and looks to be very dog friendly (water bowl, bed, leash, toys, and enclosed yard). All the finishes and furnishings were like-new and the place is tastefully decorated. The mini-kitchen is usable for quick snack or breakfast, but not really setup for making larger meals, but it's fully stocked (nice selection of teas and coffee) and was more than fine for our visit. The heat and AC worked great (we actually needed both this trip - and way quieter than a hotel unit). It's only a 5 min drive to downtown or the south shopping center and a quick 20 minute drive to Ashland if you are heading to OSF. Great coffee (hi Noble in Ashland) is right down the block at Forage. Highly recommend and will definitely seek out for our next visit.

Great studio. It's within walking distance of downtown restaurants. Also a perfect location for people coming to Medford to do business with the city or Jackson County--government offices are only a block away.
Very comfortable bed. There's no desk, but there are laptop tables so you can easily work from the couch. There's a private outdoor patio with a lovely container garden, with plenty of outdoor furniture so you can sit and relax.
The host is right nearby in case of any questions, and very responsive. He also gave me a great recommendation for a local coffee shop nearby. Definitely a spot I'd stay in again.

review_text: I had a very comfortable stay. I was in town for two nights for work. The space is cozy with nice decorative touches, very clean, easy to find, off-street parking, about a 10 minute walk to the cute downtown of Medford. The private garden space with tons of potted plants and Adirondack chairs was a nice place to unwind at the end of the day. The hosts were friendly and communicative. They live next door and give you plenty of privacy, but are available if you need anything. You do share a wall with the front unit in the house. It wasn't loud, but if there are other guests you may hear light "neighbor noises". It was not a bother, just something to be aware of if that is something you are sensitive to. name: Kylie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
First off I came in very late at night and the host was aware of my late arrival time. Kathryn’s property was well lit with a lit walk way to the home. The porch light was also on. Along the walk way was a lovely garden.
Coming in the home was clean, smelt good but no strong perfume odors and felt welcoming. Minimum clutter and modern amenities. The bathroom was large for a tiny home. There’s a lot of windows so it feels much bigger. All with wooden blinds. The bed was large and very cushy. You sink right in. As someone who needs more support in a bed it was personally to cloud like for me but I’m sure a lot more people would appreciate it if you’re into that. It was a great bed just not great for me.
I had brought my dog with me. She was welcomed with a leash, poop bags, a water bottle and a food bowl. I was very grateful for how dog friendly this home was. I got a look at their dog on property who seemed very well behaved and had no reactions to my dog at all.
I would book again.

review_text:
This tiny house was very cozy! I could have stayed in that bed all day!!!!The bathroom was small but very functional and the shower was great. The wifi was good and the streaming services worked quite well. Communication with the hosts was excellent.
If there are two of you and you like to read a real book at night, I suggest that you bring a clip on book light. Otherwise the person near the wall won't be able to read (there is an overhead light above the bed but it is too bright for reading, and you'd have to climb out of bed to turn it off.) I just invested in these after this trip - tiny spaces are so wonderfully cozy but they don't always have enough space to place reading lights on both sides of the bed.

review_text:
Stayed here on my way and this time on my return trip home:
The tiny house is pure perfection from the natural garden filled with pumpkins to pomegranates,
to bird/bee loving colorful flower and trees ! (BTW the bees were not near the Eco-tiny house,
nor were they a problem anywhere!)
Easy to find, quiet, cozy, everything thoughtfully and beautifully placed and provided, perfectly clean,
EVERYTHING you could possibly need or want; plus a wonderfully comfortable bed. (pillows and linen were heaven). And then there was the organic fair-trade yummy array of teas, coffee AND even stamp sealed TP - impressive ;) !
It's obvious Kathryn, her family (and helpers) all love and care for their home and the planet.
Beautiful experience - I'll be back, next time hopefully to share it with my husband.

review_text: Loved our stay (although short) at Kathryn's Eco-Tiny House. My bestfriend and I were travelling from Washington to California and decided to cut the drive halfway through (Medford, Oregon). Found this gem of a place and everything written on the description is up to par with what you would expect once you get there. It was easy to find, the place was very comfy and homey, and it felt like the host thoroughly planned each detail ahead for the guests' needs. We drove for almost 10hours and as we arrived, we immediately felt a sense of rest (as though we've already returned home). We capped off the night with a complimentary tea (lots to choose from) and relaxed with some YouTube music in the background/a short Netflix show episode before bedtime. The host is very responsive to my inquiries and the price is so worth it. 20 out of 10 experience - definitely recommend this place!

The hosts were also generous with their EV charger, although I could not get it to work on the Tesla for some reason (certainly not the fault of the hosts, they came out and were very helpful! I’m just new to the whole Tesla thing.) The front yard has lovely sunflowers and pomegranates, which made my morning. Would love to stay there again.

,

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
This place was amazing. Perfectly described.
I wanted something away from the normal hotel experience, calm, and peaceful. This provided my dog and I everything. There was even a dedicated parking spot.
Inside was warm and inviting. All amenities were available. Sweet and cozy. I enjoyed all the natural light, but can be controlled by the blinds.
We stayed two days. I walked my dog around the block and the neighbors were great.
It was nice to be so close to many stores and parks.
I will stay here next time in town.
